alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued February 23 at 2:49AM PST until February 24 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 17 expected. * WHERE...Apple and Lucerne Valleys. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * IMPACTS..The hard freeze could kill crops, and other sensitive vegetation. It may also damage uninsulated plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Thursday night is not expected to be as cold, but still with sub-freezing temperatures in most locations.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
